title: How to Chant
steps: Treat chanting as a spiritual discipline.
Repeat an autosuggestion after chanting sessions.
Chant silently throughout the day.

title: How to Sing in a Straight Tone
steps: Practice by singing children's songs.
Progress to more demanding pieces of music.
Avoid singing with a straight tone too often.
Use a straight tone to sing non-classical styles of music.

title: How to Sing in Front of a Large Audience
steps: Figure out what song you will sing.
Practice.
Sing the song in front of someone you trust.
Forget the big crowd.
Practice!.
Sing.

title: How to Sing Louder
steps: Sing right into the middle of the microphone.
Sing with your lips almost touching the microphone.
Soften your "P" or "B" sounds.
Adjust your singing to fit the song.

title: How to Hum
steps: Hum to prepare your vocal cords.
Alternate between a high and low hum.
Run through musical scales.
Hum as you breathe.

title: How to Sing Loud Without Harming Yourself
steps: Drink water before and after singing.
Don't sing so loud that it hurts.
Sing with your diaphragm.
Try not to sleep with your mouth open.
Work your way up to singing loud gradually.
Don't scream.
Don't whisper too often.
Try not to trigger allergies.

title: How to Throat Sing
steps: Practice with some background noise.
Sing with a loud, bright voice.
Focus on singing from your upper chest.
Practice changing notes.
Listen to real life examples.

title: How to Sing in Tune
steps: Apply your newly learned vocal control by mastering a song.
Recognize and accept that some notes are outside your vocal range.
Build a repertoire of songs you are comfortable singing.
Challenge yourself with increasingly difficult songs.

title: How to Sing High Notes and Songs
steps: Sing a song that is higher than your typical vocal range by beginning the tune in a lower octave.
Sing using your stomach, not your throat.
Breathe with your diaphragm, while standing a straight as possible.
Remember to switch to your falsetto voice as you sing notes at the top of your range.

title: How to Sing Classically
steps: Explore your vocal range.
Practice proper breathing techniques.
Work on your diction.
Start with something easy, like an English folk song.
Practice singing a classical piece in English.
Practice classical singing techniques like legato and coloratura.
Attend your voice lessons regularly.
Practice regularly.
Audition for a role in a local performance.

title: How to Develop the Proper Posture for Singing
steps: Avoid locking your knees.
Stand with your feet shoulder width apart.
Shift your weight slightly forward.
Test your new singing posture.

title: How to Sing Better With Larynx Control
steps: Be aware how your voice works.
To prevent pulling, work around your vocal registers, employing different 'tools' to help you.
Make a yawning dopey sound.
If you have persistent problems with your larynx, you may wish to attend singing schools that are designed to deal with the larynx such as 'SLS' or 'Singing success'.
The larynx is an important part of your voice to master, however,it is not the be all and end all of singing.
If your range is small, and you have trouble changing it, then keep trying with a teacher.
Keep singing, embrace your own voice and style and have fun.
Music is a career that permits joy!.

title: How to Sing Clearly
steps: Control your breathing.
Articulate your words clearly so listeners can understand the lyrics.
Be very deliberate when enunciating your vowels.
Practice scales to see a noticeable improvement in your tone and clarity.
Replace the words in a well-known song to help you enunciate clearly.

title: How to Sing Vibrato
steps: Keep your vibrato subtle.
Use vibrato selectively.
Relax your jaw while singing vibrato.

title: How to Learn Head and Chest Voice in Singing
steps: Learn what chest and head voice are.
Learn what they feel like.
To sing in your chest voice, begin speaking in your normal voice.
To sing in your head voice, begin a high voice, but not a squeaky voice.
Be careful.

title: How to Sing Beautifully
steps: Warm-up before singing.
Stay hydrated.
Get plenty of sleep.
Avoid large amounts of alcohol, caffeine, and dairy.
Try not to yell.
Avoid smoking.
